body_html:
Please ask questions on StackOverflow instead of opening bugs. For timeseries stuff feel free to send the SO link to allenl@google.com.

But the LSTM example model does not operate on a fixed window; the same model can take any window size, like dynamic_rnn. You can set the truncated backprop length by setting a different window size in the input function. For ARRegressor the model and input function window sizes have to match for training.
body_text:
Please ask questions on StackOverflow instead of opening bugs. For timeseries stuff feel free to send the SO link to allenl@google.com.
But the LSTM example model does not operate on a fixed window; the same model can take any window size, like dynamic_rnn. You can set the truncated backprop length by setting a different window size in the input function. For ARRegressor the model and input function window sizes have to match for training.
body:
Please ask questions on StackOverflow instead of opening bugs. For timeseries stuff feel free to send the SO link to allenl@google.com.

But the LSTM example model does not operate on a fixed window; the same model can take any window size, like `dynamic_rnn`. You can set the truncated backprop length by setting a different window size in the input function. For `ARRegressor` the model and input function window sizes have to match for training.
